abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the Safe Blood Project will
            secure health benefits, through the construction of blood
            transfusion centers, and the development of regional
            programs. This resettlement action plan (RAP) looks at the
            potential, adverse relocation issues resulting from
            implementation of the project, specifically in the Can Tho
            Province, within an urban development area. Following a
            review of the country's legal, and regulatory
            framework, and compliance with the Bank's guidelines on
            resettlement, the RAP stipulates the following compensation
            policy: 1) land losses which are less than twenty five
            percent of the total area of holdings of the project
            affected people (PAP), will be compensated in cash at
            substitution costs; 2) conversely, losses over twenty five
            percent of total land area, will be compensated in terms of
            land for land arrangements; 3) compensation for houses, and
            structures will be provided in cash at substitution costs,
            with no deductions on depreciation for salvageable
            materials; 3) perennial trees, and other losses will be
            compensated at substitution costs, while annual crop losses
            will be based on market prices; and,4) allowances for moving
            expenses, and relocation transport of materials, and
            furniture will be provided, while specified subsidies will
            be paid in cash for houses partially impacted; for
            entitlement to house relocation; for business losses; for
            affected war veterans; and, for family entitlements.
